alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 11:50PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Hot Springs, north central Fremont and southeastern Park Counties through 1230 AM MDT... At 1150 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Wapiti to 9 miles south of Washakie Needles. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Buffalo Bill State Park around 1210 AM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Anchor Dam and Cody. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin
